subject: Web3
title: The NFT Bubble
description: A fast breakdown of The NFT Bubble for builders.

hook.text: In 2021, the NFT market hit $25 billion in sales. By 2023, monthly volume had crashed over 95%.

buildup.text: Celebrities, brands, and influencers all rushed to launch NFT projects. FOMO drove prices to absurd levels.

discovery.text: Bored Ape Yacht Club avatars sold for hundreds of thousands. Owning one meant celebrity status in crypto.

twist.text: When crypto prices fell, NFT prices followed. Collections that were worth millions became nearly worthless.

climax.text: The crash didn't kill NFTs. It killed the speculation. Serious projects continued building through the downturn.

punchline.text: The bubble popped. The technology survived.

quiz.question: What happened to the NFT market after 2021?
options: It moved to a new blockchain
